author: Gino D'Acampo
method: Heat the sugar in a frying pan until melted and bubbling, then add the apple, cut-side down. Allow the sugar to begin to caramelise, then add the brandy and cream, stirring a little to coat the apple.  Boil the sauce for 2-3 minutes, or until thickened, then remove from the heat.  To serve, place the apple cut-side down on a plate and pour over the brandy sauce.
ingredients: 2 tbsp brown sugar,  ½ Bramley apple, core removed,  ½ miniature bottle brandy,  50ml/2fl oz double cream
